pullRequest.title: Add support of offering ConnectedDirectionsData for some block states
pullRequest.bodyText:
This changes allow to offer ConnectedDirectionsData for the following blocks:

Fences
Panes
Redstone Wire
Trip Wire
Vine
Wall

The most important thing here is vine. It was these blocks that I could not correctly placed in a world with all flags turned off. But for completeness, I implemented wherever possible.
I also noticed that there are many more keys that cannot be offered to blocks. Of course, it probably makes no sense to offer, for example, to a redstone wire Keys.POWER, but it seems to me that this should be implemented anyway. I can do this, but I need your feedback on this.

nodes.bodyText: I'd rather not have a static field at all. Also, the field needs to be prefixed according to the naming standards for mixin-added-by-sponge names, i.e. impl$DIRECTION_TO_PROPERTY_MAPPING.
This really should not be statically initialized, I'd rather a constructor injection to initialize the field.
Don't align multi-line like this, just indent on continuation.
Same with this. Don't indent to align.
Don't make new utils. Put it in an existing utils class.

nodes.bodyText: If it's not static to the Block itself, and it's something as a translation, then there's a TypeProvider bit of the registry implementation, and there's also Constants that can contain these type mappings where you can make some better static constants like this rather than in the mixin itself.
Pretty much all the mappings for the specific block types can exist in here, or as a type provider. That's what I mean by reducing the amount of static usage in the mixins themselves.
